info.headline: Cold Weather Advisory issued November 10 at 12:56AM EST until November 11 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Jacksonville FL
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 27 expected. For the Cold Weather Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 20 expected.
* WHERE...Northeastern Charlton and Pierce Counties.
* WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 8 AM EST Tuesday. For the Cold Weather Advisory, from 2 AM to 8 AM EST Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills as low as 20 degrees could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken. Appropriate action should be taken to ensure tender vegetation and outdoor pets have adequate protection from the cold temperatures. Young children, the elderly and the homeless are especially vulnerable to the cold. Take measures to protect them.
info.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
Keep pets indoors as much as possible.
Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside.
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

parameter.value: FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 AM EST TUESDAY... ...COLD WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM EST TUESDAY
